lexUnit.name: commute.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: reduce (a judicial sentence, especially a sentence of death) to a less severe one

sentence.text: The first releases occurred in mid-July when the government commuted all death sentences and proclaimed an amnesty for all political and some criminal prisoners .
The Head of State commuted the sentences to 15 years ' imprisonment .
De Graaff commuted the sentence to two years , and in actuality Sukarno was released on 15 December 1931 .

It had been widely expected that President Zine al-Abidine Ben Ali , whose distaste for capital punishment for politically motivated crimes had been well publicized , would commute the death sentences .
The Prime Minister , Shaikh Saad al Abdullah as Salim as Sabah , commuted on June 26 the death sentences imposed on 29 people ( three of them women ) for collaborating with the Iraqi authorities .
He insisted their sentence should be commuted to life imprisonment .
Although sentenced to death by the Supreme Court of East Germany his sentence was commuted to one of life imprisonment , but he has never been heard of again .
The two others , Daniel Santovenia Fernández and Pedro de la Caridad Alvárez Pedroso , had their sentences commuted to 30 years ' imprisonment .
There was no break for the rest of that day , and by late afternoon Major Sakata , Sergeant Akida and Corporal Sushi had had their sentences commuted to life imprisonment .
In 1990 the state of Louisiana electrocuted Dalton Prejean , despite a recommendation by the Pardons and Parole Board that his sentence be commuted to life imprisonment .
When Ako Adjei , Adamafio and Crabbe were given a second trial they were condemned to death : but the sentence was commuted by Nkrumah to life imprisonment .
His sentence was commuted to beheading and he was executed at Amiens in 1766 .
He was sentenced to death in 1983 , although the sentence was commuted to a 20-year prison term in 1991 .
After laying down arms she was court-martialled in Kilmainham Gaol , but her death sentence was commuted to penal servitude for life in Aylesbury Gaol .
